name: Access Control (Limit information system access to authorized users and processes)

items.question: AC.L1-3.1.1 - Access Control Policy & Account Management
items.codingInstructions: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).

items.question: Do you have an Access Control Policy?

answers.text: No - if no, would you like help creating one for your company?

items.question: Access Control Policy Elements
Does your organization have a documented access control policy that addresses:

items.codingInstructions: Establish clear access control rules, including who can access what information, how access is granted, reviewed, and revoked
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish clear access control rules, including who can access what information, how access is granted, reviewed, and revoked

items.question: User Account Registry
How many accounts are currently in your systems?

items.codingInstructions: Maintain a detailed and up-to-date record of all user accounts, including their access levels and status
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Maintain a detailed and up-to-date record of all user accounts, including their access levels and status

items.question: Principle of Least Privilege Implementation
How is the principle of least privilege implemented?

items.codingInstructions: Grant users and systems only the minimum access necessary to perform their tasks
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Grant users and systems only the minimum access necessary to perform their tasks

items.question: Account Management Processes
How are account lifecycle processes managed?

items.codingInstructions: Establish and follow formal procedures to manage user accounts throughout their lifecycle
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish and follow formal procedures to manage user accounts throughout their lifecycle

items.question: Account Review Frequency
How frequently are user accounts reviewed for validity and appropriate access?

items.codingInstructions: Regularly review user accounts to verify access is still appropriate and remove or adjust accounts as needed
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Regularly review user accounts to verify access is still appropriate and remove or adjust accounts as needed

items.question: AC.L1-3.1.2 - Transaction & Function Control
items.codingInstructions: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

items.question: Transaction Control Implementation
How do you limit user access to specific transactions and functions?

items.codingInstructions: Implement controls to monitor and regulate transactions, ensuring only authorized actions are performed within systems and applications
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement controls to monitor and regulate transactions, ensuring only authorized actions are performed within systems and applications

items.question: Function Restrictions by Role
What types of functions are restricted based on user roles?

answers.text: Data export and bulk download functions

value.text: Data export and bulk download functions

items.codingInstructions: Limit system functions and capabilities based on user roles to ensure individuals can only perform actions necessary for their job responsibilities
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit system functions and capabilities based on user roles to ensure individuals can only perform actions necessary for their job responsibilities

items.question: Transaction Authorization Requirements
items.codingInstructions: Require formal approval before critical transactions are executed to prevent unauthorized or fraudulent activities.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Require formal approval before critical transactions are executed to prevent unauthorized or fraudulent activities.

items.question: AC.L1-3.1.20 - External Connections
items.codingInstructions: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.

items.question: External System Connections
What types of external systems does your organization connect to?

items.codingInstructions: Manage and secure connections to external systems to protect your network from unauthorized access and data breaches.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Manage and secure connections to external systems to protect your network from unauthorized access and data breaches.

items.question: Connection Verification Methods
How do you verify external system connections?

items.codingInstructions: Use verification techniques to confirm the identity and security of external connections before allowing access to your systems
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Use verification techniques to confirm the identity and security of external connections before allowing access to your systems

items.question: Connection Control Limitations
What limitations are placed on external connections?

answers.text: Restrictions on data types that can be shared
Management approval required for each connection

value.text: Restrictions on data types that can be shared

items.codingInstructions: Define and enforce restrictions on external connections to minimize exposure and reduce security risks.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Define and enforce restrictions on external connections to minimize exposure and reduce security risks.

items.question: AC.L1-3.1.22 - Control Public Information
items.codingInstructions: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems.

items.question: Publicly Accessible Systems
What publicly accessible systems does your organization operate?

items.codingInstructions: Secure and monitor systems that are accessible to the public to prevent unauthorized access and data leakage.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Secure and monitor systems that are accessible to the public to prevent unauthorized access and data leakage.

items.question: Content Review Process
How do you ensure FCI is not posted on public systems?

answers.text: Designated reviewers trained to identify FCI
Automated content scanning for sensitive information
Procedures for rapid removal of inappropriate content

value.text: Procedures for rapid removal of inappropriate content

items.codingInstructions: Establish regular procedures to review and validate information before it is published or shared
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish regular procedures to review and validate information before it is published or shared

items.question: Authorized Publishing Personnel
Who is authorized to post content to public systems?

items.codingInstructions: Designate and control who is allowed to publish or distribute organizational information
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Designate and control who is allowed to publish or distribute organizational information
